articles.title: Theory-driven analysis for ecological data
articles.description: FRB-CESAB & GdR TheoMoDive training course
articles.contents:
Pre-registration opens each spring and training course is provided each winter. Subscribe to the FRB-CESAB newsletter to stay informed. More information is available on the FRB-CESAB website.


The objective of this five-day workshop, co-organized by the
FRB-CESAB
and the
GdR TheoMoDive
is to train young researchers in theory-based approaches to model ecological data
(e.g. temporal series, macroecology, interaction and trophic network, etc.).
N.B. This training course is in English and slides are available in the tab Courses/.

Program

Monday


Speakers: Isabelle Gounand, Sonia Kéfi & Vincent Calcagno


Icebreaker & Introduction to the week


Mathematical modeling & Theory



Tuesday


Speakers: Emanuel Fronhofer


Temporal series and dynamics in ecology



Wednesday


Speakers: Vincent Calcagno & Quentin Petitjean


Spatial data, macro-ecology and co-occurrences



Guest seminar: Davide Martinetti (INRAE, Avignon)



Thursday


Speakers: François Massol & Claire Jacquet


Interaction networks, trophic networks & complexity



Guest speaker: Matthieu Barbier (CIRAD, Montpellier & INTP)



Guest seminar: Sonia Kéfi (CNRS, Montpellier)



Friday


Subgroups projects


Prerequisites
If you want ready-to-use working environment for R, follow this tutorial. For this course, you don’t need to install git and Docker.

See also
Discover the other training courses provided by the FRB-CESAB and its partners: https://frbcesab.github.io/training-courses/
Citation
Calcagno V, Fronhofer EA, Gounand I, Jacquet C, Kéfi C & Massol F (2025)
FRB-CESAB & GdR TheoMoDive training course: Theory-driven analysis for ecological data.
